metadata.title: CVE-2023-52683 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: ACPI:LPIT: Avoid u32 multiplication overflow In lpit_update_residency() there isa possibility of overflow in multiplication, if tsc_khz is large enough (>UINT_MAX/1000). Change multiplication to mul_u32_u32(). Found by LinuxVerification Center (linuxtesting.org) with SVACE.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52683` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-102-generic - 5.15.0-102.112
linux-image-5.15.0-102-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-102.112
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-102-generic - 5.15.0-102.112
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-102-generic-64k - 5.15.0-102.112
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-41-generic - 6.5.0-41.41~22.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-41-generic - 6.5.0-41.41~22.04.2

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-102.112').
